marketNews.title: Israel Accuses Iran of Violating Ceasefire
marketNews.content: Head of Israel Defense Forces Staff, Eyal Zamir, said on Tuesday (24/6) that Israel will respond to Iran "with violence" after accusing Iran of violating the ceasefire agreement. Previously, the US government together with Qatar on Monday (23/6) night tried to push Israel and Iran to achieve a ceasefire by stopping their attacks, according to Axios. Axios continued that both parties had agreed to the ceasefire before US President Donald Trump announced it that same night. However, Israel accused Iran of violating the agreement, claiming it detected a missile launch from Iran after the ceasefire. On the other side, Iranian military and state media denied the accusation. Although Israel threatened to respond "with violence", Trump announced on Tuesday (24/6) that the ceasefire between Israel and Iran is officially in effect. Responding to recent developments, Brent futures for the August 2025 contract moved volatile throughout Tuesday (24/6) trading. Nevertheless, the intraday price on Tuesday (24/6) at $69.1 per barrel (down 3.3%) in the afternoon continued the decline of 7.2% on Monday (23/6), following Iran's step of not closing the Strait of Hormuz and news of the ceasefire agreement. Meanwhile, equity markets reacted positively on Tuesday (24/6) with the Nikkei up 1.16%, the SSE up 1.15% and the Indonesian Composite Index (IHSG) up 1.21%. S&P Futures rose 0.74% in the afternoon after the S&P 500 rose 1% on Monday (23/6) local time. Gold price fell 1.26% to 3,327 per Tuesday afternoon. Key Takeaway: The significant oil price drop caused a correction of several oil-related stocks such as ENRG (down 9.33%), MEDC (down 8.97%) and ELSA (down 5.20%) on Tuesday (24/6) after a rally since the conflict began. Meanwhile, the still positive market movement amid ceasefire violation accusations indicates optimism that the de-escalation progress is generally moving in a positive direction.

marketNews.title: Other Hot News
marketNews.content: 1. Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia claimed that Russia will invest more than US$10 billion (approximately 164.8 trillion rupiah) in Indonesia's upstream oil and gas sector, focusing on older, less productive fields using Russian technology, with Block Tuna in the northern Natuna offshore as a target. 2. PT Gaia Artha Dinamic increased its shareholding in Sumber Sinergi Makmur (IOTF) by 90.8 million shares (1.72%) worth 11.35 billion rupiah at an average price of 125 rupiah per share, raising its total holding to about 369.3 million shares (6.98%). 3. Logindo Samudramakmur (LEAD) announced the sale of one vessel valued at US$965,000 (approximately 1.6 billion rupiah) to boost cash and repay part of its debt. 4. Indonesia's crude palm oil (CPO) stock rose 50% month-on-month to 3.04 million tons in April 2025, the highest level since May 2024, while export volume fell 38.1% month-on-month to 1.78 million tons due to reduced demand. 5. Fuji Finance Indonesia (FUJI) saw shareholder Charnic Capital (NICK) purchase 130 million FUJI shares at an average price of 40 rupiah per share on 23 June 2025, a transaction worth 5.2 billion rupiah, increasing NICK's ownership in FUJI from 13.48% to 23.48%.

tickerNews.title: GIAA receives US$405 million capital injection from Danantara
tickerNews.content: GIAA: BPI Danantara on Tuesday (24/6) officially injected capital of 405 million US dollars, equivalent to about 6.65 trillion rupiah, into Garuda Indonesia, marking Danantara's first investment since its establishment in early 2025. The capital injection is provided as a shareholder loan and is part of total financing planned to reach 1 billion US dollars. GIAA CEO Wamildan Tsani said that at the initial stage, the funds will be focused on maintenance and improving operational readiness of Garuda and Citilink fleets. Previously, Bloomberg on Wednesday (4/6) reported that GIAA was exploring a capital injection of 500 million US dollars from Danantara in two stages.

tickerNews.title: AMMN director sells approximately 39.5 million shares
tickerNews.content: AMMN: Director of Amman Mineral International, David Alexander Gibbs, sold approximately 39.5 million AMMN shares at an average price of about 7,991 rupiah per share between 16-19 June 2025. Total transaction value reached about 315.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, David Alexander Gibbs' ownership in AMMN decreased from 0.109% to 0.055%.

tickerNews.title: ULTJ announces share buyback up to 1 billion shares
tickerNews.content: ULTJ: Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company announced a buyback plan of up to approximately 1 billion (10%) shares during the period 25 June-25 September 2025. Estimated funds for the buyback are 1.45 trillion rupiah. The plan does not require shareholder meeting approval, following relaxation granted by OJK to support market stability. Previously, ULTJ announced a buyback plan in March 2025, but said it had not been realized due to volatile market conditions.

tickerNews.title: UNTR reports May 2025 Komatsu equipment sales
tickerNews.content: UNTR: United Tractors recorded sales of Komatsu heavy equipment amounting to 463 units in May 2025 (down 7.6% month-on-month, up 29.7% year-on-year). Cumulatively during the first five months of 2025 (5M25), Komatsu equipment sales reached 2,349 units (up 33.7% YoY), equal to 51% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share at 26% (vs. 4M25: 26%, 5M24: 28%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 55.1 million tons (down 3.5% YoY) during 5M25, with overburden removal of 434 million bcm (down 11.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: SMGR sees decline in cement sales in May 2025
tickerNews.content: SMGR: Semen Indonesia reported a decline in cement sales volume of 5.4% year-on-year in May 2025, as domestic sales fell 9.6% year-on-year despite a 29% month-on-month increase after Lebaran. By segment, bag cement sales contributed 71.6% in May 2025 (vs. April 2025: 74.7%) and 72.1% during 5M25 (vs. 4M25: 72.2%). During 5M25, SMGR's sales volume decreased 0.3% year-on-year (vs. 5M24: +0.1% YoY), better than the industry which fell 2.1% year-on-year (vs. 5M24: +2.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PYFA plans bond issuance up to 420 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: PYFA: Pyridam Farma plans to issue bonds up to 420 billion rupiah, with proceeds intended for repayment of 2023 bonds and working capital. The bonds have received an irA- rating from PT Kredit Rating Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: ISSP announces 2024 cash dividend of 112.82 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: ISSP: Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia will distribute a cash dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately 112.82 billion rupiah or 16 rupiah per share. This amount corresponds to about 21.3% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~21.3%) and indicates a dividend yield of about 4.8% as of Tuesday (24/6). The cum date in the regular market and negotiation is July 1 2025, while payment is on July 24 2025.

tickerNews.title: PGEO to cooperate with Pertamina Geothermal on 3 GW project
tickerNews.content: PGEO: BPI Danantara will cooperate with Pertamina Geothermal Energy on the development of geothermal energy of 3 GW. The investment amount is not yet known, but previously PGEO said it opened cooperation opportunities with Danantara for geothermal power plant development with a target capacity of 1.8 GW by 2033 requiring investment of 6-7 billion US dollars.
